Results.Name: Albert Einstein
Results.Achievements: Developed the theory of relativity (Special and General), explained the photoelectric effect, and made significant contributions to quantum mechanics.

Results.Name: Isaac Newton
Results.Achievements: Laid the foundation for classical mechanics with the laws of motion and the law of universal gravitation.

Results.Name: Niels Bohr
Results.Achievements: Made significant contributions to the understanding of atomic structure and quantum theory.

Results.Name: Galileo Galilei
Results.Achievements: Improved the telescope, observed celestial bodies, and championed the heliocentric model of the solar system.

Results.Name: Max Planck
Results.Achievements: Formulated quantum theory and introduced the concept of quantized energy.

Results.Name: Richard Feynman
Results.Achievements: Contributed to quantum mechanics and quantum electrodynamics, awarded the Nobel Prize in Physics.

Results.Name: Marie Curie
Results.Achievements: Pioneering research on radioactivity, discovered radium and polonium, and won two Nobel Prizes (Physics and Chemistry).

Results.Name: Erwin Schrödinger
Results.Achievements: Developed the Schrödinger equation, a foundational equation in quantum mechanics.

Results.Name: Stephen Hawking
Results.Achievements: Worked on black holes, Hawking radiation, and the nature of the universe despite battling ALS.

Results.Name: Werner Heisenberg
Results.Achievements: Formulated the uncertainty principle, a key concept in quantum mechanics.
